p: Forced separation from pets can negatively impact the mental health of pet owners. Losing a pet in the case of natural disaster leads to significant grief and mourning (Hunt et al. 2008). Pet loss increases risk of post-traumatic stress and intensifies the severity of depressive symptoms following a disaster (Hall et al. 2004; Lowe et al. 2009). Finally, families that are separated from companion animals during disasters face further challenges when attempting to find their pets—and reunion rates remain low (Heath and Linnabary 2015).
